step1.sentence: She reminded herself that practice makes perfect every time she stumbled through a new piano piece.

step2.story: Jake struggled with his tennis serve for weeks, missing shot after shot. His coach smiled and told him that practice makes perfect, encouraging him to keep going. By the end of the month, Jake's serve was the strongest on the team.

step3.story: Maya had always dreamed of becoming a baker, but her first attempts at croissants came out flat and dense. Her grandmother watched patiently and said, 'Don't give up — practice makes perfect.' Every weekend, Maya returned to the kitchen, adjusting her technique little by little. She paid attention to the temperature of the butter, the angle of her folds, and the timing of each rest. Months later, she pulled a tray of golden, flaky croissants from the oven and finally understood what her grandmother had meant. The journey of repeated effort had quietly transformed her into the baker she had always wanted to be.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 연습을 반복하면 완벽함에 이를 수 있다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 기술이나 능력을 익히기 위해 꾸준히 노력해야 한다고 격려할 때 사용한다. 실수하거나 실망한 사람에게 포기하지 말고 계속 연습하라고 독려하는 맥락에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 16세기 영어 속담에서 유래했으며, 라틴어 격언 'uses promptos facit(사용이 능숙함을 만든다)'에 뿌리를 두고 있다. 오랜 세월 동안 영어권 문화에서 노력의 중요성을 강조하는 대표적인 표현으로 자리 잡았다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 격려하는 어조를 지닌 표현으로, 지나치게 진지하거나 설교적으로 들리지 않는다. 일상 대화, 코칭, 교육 현장에서 자연스럽게 사용되며 누구에게나 친숙하게 받아들여진다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I know the speech feels awkward now, but practice makes perfect.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 지금은 발표가 어색하게 느껴지겠지만, 연습이 완벽을 만드는 법이야.
